Welcome to maven-less-compiler-plugin module

Introduction

less is a great way to build CSS. The maven-less-compiler-plugin Maven Plugin is meant to provide an easy way to build your CSS files from Less ones at build time.

Usage

By default the plugin searches through your src/main/webapp folder for any .less file. Each Less file found is then compiled into CSS and included as part of your regular WAR build.

Here is an annotated POM example:

<plugin>
    <groupId>com.kalixia.maven.plugins</groupId>
    <artifactId>maven-less-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
    <version>0.0.1</version>
    <executions>
        <execution>
            <goals>
                <goal>compile</goal>
            </goals>
        </execution>
    </executions>
</plugin>

Advanced Usage

If you are building Twitter's Bootstrap framework, you'll need to make sure that you only include the bootstrap.less as the other less files are actually included from this one. This can easily be done:

<plugin>
    <groupId>com.kalixia.maven.plugins</groupId>
    <artifactId>maven-less-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
    <version>0.0.1</version>
    <configuration>
        <includes>
            <include>**/bootstrap.less</include>
        </includes>
    </configuration>
    <executions>
        <execution>
            <goals>
                <goal>compile</goal>
            </goals>
        </execution>
    </executions>
</plugin>

Maven Repository

Don't forget to declare the Maven repository so that Maven can locate this plugin:

<repository>
    <id>maven-less-compiler-plugin</id>
    <url>http://kalixia.github.com/maven-less-compiler-plugin/repository/</url>
    <snapshots>
        <enabled>true</enabled>
    </snapshots>
    <releases>
        <enabled>true</enabled>
    </releases>
</repository>
